Subjects: Christ, love of; love, of Christ
_description: Christ’s Love-Song to Man — three 6-line stanzas (aabccb) in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

NLS18721.First Lines: Love me brouthteAnd love me wrouthte…
NLS18721.Last Lines: …Wel is meI have þe wonnen in fith
NLS18721.Attributed Title:
Arma Christi (f. 120v); ‘Ihesus’ (f. 121, as if
                    introducing the speaker)

Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.

         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 84.

             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 168-9.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 198.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 210-11.
